Cannot add Physical Sciences after Grade 10

minimum_requirements.overall: Must pass at least 6 of 7 subjects

university_admission.subject_specific: Each program has specific subject and performance requirements

Pass in any 4 subjects including Home Language at 40%+

common_student_questions.question: Can I change from Math Lit to Mathematics in Grade 11?
common_student_questions.answer: No, this change must be made by the end of Grade 10 Term 1. After that, the curriculum gap is too large to bridge.
common_student_questions.alternatives: Consider TVET programs or bridging courses for technical careers

common_student_questions.question: What happens if I fail one subject?
common_student_questions.answer: You can still be promoted if you meet other requirements (40% in Home Language + 2 others, 30% in 3 others). You can fail maximum 1 subject.
common_student_questions.note: Failed subject may limit university program options

common_student_questions.question: Do I need to pass Life Orientation?
common_student_questions.answer: Yes, you need 40% in Life Orientation to get your NSC, but it doesn't count towards university APS calculations.

common_student_questions.question: Can I add Physical Sciences in Grade 11?
common_student_questions.answer: No, Physical Sciences has too much foundational content from Grade 10. Must be selected by Grade 10.
common_student_questions.alternatives: Consider Life Sciences or other science pathways

common_student_questions.question: What if my school stops offering my subject?
common_student_questions.answer: This is an exceptional circumstance that may allow subject changes with provincial approval.
common_student_questions.process: School must apply to provincial department with documentation

provincial_variations.implementation: National policy implemented consistently across provinces
variations: Some provinces may have slightly different deadlines for subject changes
Rural schools may have limited subject offerings affecting progression
Language medium availability varies by province and district
support_systems: Provincial subject advisors available for guidance
